etymologies: mid 16th century: from medieval Latin vicegerent- ‘(person) holding office’, from Latin vic- ‘office, place, turn’ + gerere ‘carry on, hold’

definitions: a person exercising delegated power on behalf of a sovereign or ruler.
shortDefinitions: person exercising delegated power on behalf of sovereign or ruler

definitions: a person regarded as an earthly representative of God or a god, especially the Pope.
shortDefinitions: person regarded as earthly representative of God or god
